name: Betty's 3-Bean Hot Dish (a la Minnesota)
author: MrsWifey/Mommy
summary: My dearest 80-something friend Betty gave me this sensational, hearty recipe for a 3-bean hot dish. She's Finnish, I believe this has roots to home, and it's really tasty! My hubby, who hates beans, demanded I get the recipe. We first devoured it at Betty and Jim's 60th wedding anniversary! Perfect for potlucks.
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can pork and beans, drained
directions: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Drain bacon slices on paper towels
Wipe out skillet with a paper towel
Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
Add onion and cook until clear, about 5 minutes more
Combine cooked bacon, cooked beef, pork and beans, kidney beans, butter beans, ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, and mustard in a slow cooker
Cook on High until heated through, about 1 hour
